Description.En:
“If you can’t describe your business model in ten words or fewer, you don’t have a business model.” – Guy Kawasaki

“Whatever it is, every idea you present must be something you could get across easily at a cocktail party with strangers. If only aficionados of your industry can understand what you're saying, you've blown it.” – Jack Welch

“You can have brilliant ideas, but if you can’t get them across, your ideas won’t get you anywhere.”–  Lee Iacocca

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
This course will take place online. Students are required to watch videos and complete pre and post-assignments between lectures. The meetings serve as opportunities for students to discuss course content, ask questions about the assignments, and participate in group work sessions.

To ensure a productive learning experience students are expected to come prepared for each session by completing all required videos and assignments beforehand.

check calendar and detailed syllabus here: [https://www.soi.unitn.it/courses/communicating-innovation/](https://www.soi.unitn.it/courses/communicating-innovation/)

This course equips participants with the communication techniques and strategies employed by entrepreneurs, innovators, and game-changers when presenting innovative ideas. A fundamental challenge faced at various stages of business development is conveying effectively the value of business ideas to stakeholders, customers, and investors through both oral and written communication. In this short course students will explore startup jargon concepts and techniques as they create a comprehensive communication strategy for an innovation project.

To apply, please upload:

- your CV in English;
- if available, the English language certification
- a brief motivational letter (1.000 characters) OR a motivational video (max 40’’, preferably youtube link) where you explain WHY you are interested in THIS learning opportunity.
- Transcript of records

Please identify your Applicant status:

1-UniTrento PhD or Student

2-ECIU student

3-Erasmus+ or Bilateral agreement student (in Trento for the whole semester)

4- BIP Student (Blended intensive program Student (external to ECIU network) who plans to join Trento only to attend  a challenge).

5-Other (extra fees may apply)

Status 1, 2 and 3 applicants need to submit two applications (similar documents, same deadline on 28 January 2025):

[SOI admission apply 2024/25 - S2](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/Web/GoHome/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_2)

[ECIU Admission application](https://engage.eciu.eu/browse?universityIds=c7bc8551-6a54-ed11-bba2-6045bd886566&learningOppStatuses=1)

Status 4 and 5 applicants only submit their application in the [SOI admission apply 2024/25 - S2](https://webapps.unitn.it/Apply/it/Web/GoHome/serv-studenti/Sel_SoI_2024_2)

[Here](https://www.soi.unitn.it/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Applying_to_SOI_ECIU_activities.docx.pdf)you can find guidelines on the application process.
